items.title: Difficult Terrain
items.content: Moving through difficult terrain costs double movement. Examples include dense forests, rocky ground, deep snow, and swamps.

items.title: Stealth and Infiltration
items.content: Use cover, shadows, and distractions to move unseen. Consider ambient light, cover quality, and potential distractions when planning your approach.

items.title: Interactive Environment
items.content: Use environmental objects—ropes, barrels, chandeliers—as improvised tools or weapons in creative ways. Look for ways to gain advantage by using your surroundings.

items.title: Mystical Sites
items.content: Seek out shrines, ancient stones, or natural sanctuaries that might bestow temporary boons or provide vital warnings. These places often hold secrets or power that can aid your journey.
